Abstract: Recent advancements in electroporation technologies have significantly enhanced their application from bench to clinic. Pulsed field ablation has emerged as a promising technique for precise tissue ablation, while transfection methods have improved gene therapy delivery. Innovations in electrochemotherapy have increased the efficacy of cancer treatments. Additionally, the integration of microfluidics has optimized the control and efficiency of electroporation processes. These developments are paving the way for more effective and targeted therapeutic interventions, highlighting the potential of electroporation in clinical settings.
